poem:
### Currency Wars

In the marketplace of iron tongues,  
where gold-plated promises crumble,  
and nations barter thunder for silence,  
a lion roars atop his digital hill,  
demanding loyalty from distant lands.  
Coins clash like cymbals in the chapel,  
while undercurrents pull at ancient chains,  
binding futures to the weight of words.
